body:
Comment 3: 
If you want to access B.A.X instead of B.X, why don't you just say that?

package main

import "fmt"

type A struct {
	X int
}

type B struct {
	*A
	X int
}

func main() {
	obj := &A{1}
	obj2 := &B{obj, 2}
	fmt.Printf("X: %d\n", obj2.X)  // B.X
	fmt.Printf("X: %d\n", obj2.A.X)  // B.A.X
}

Output:
X: 2
X: 1
